intro: Oenanthe rosthornii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water dropwort, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often near water bodies. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like clusters. Oenanthe rosthornii is characterized by its distinctive, slender stems and its ability to thrive in moist environments.
